intro: Parasenecio nipponicus, commonly known as the Japanese parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
